curam.util.rules

Class RulesEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.rules.RulesEngine

  • public final class RulesEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class that provides execution-mode constants for rules.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static RulesEngine.RulesEngineMode kAssessmentPromptAsRequired
      Assessment with prompting as required execution mode.

      Assessment with prompting with default values execution mode.

      Normal execution mode.
      static RulesEngine.RulesEngineMode kQuotation
      Quotation execution mode.
      static RulesEngine.RulesEngineMode kReassessment
      Reassessment execution mode.
      static RulesEngine.RulesEngineMode kSimulation
      Simulation execution mode.

        Reassessment execution mode.

      • kSimulation

        public static final RulesEngine.RulesEngineMode kSimulation
        Simulation execution mode. This mode is intended to be use by the Rules Simulation Environment only and is not supported for any other purpose.

      • kQuotation

        public static final RulesEngine.RulesEngineMode kQuotation

        public static void setCustomDataClassName(java.lang.String newClass)
        Set name of a class containing the rules data to be used. Default value is "Data".
        Parameters:

      • resetDataClassName

        public static void resetDataClassName()
        Reset name of a class containing the rules data to be used to the default value.

      • setCustomTreeClassName

        public static void setCustomTreeClassName(java.lang.String newClass)
        Set name of a class containing the rules tree to be used. Default value is "Tree".
        Parameters:
        newClass - name of a class containing the rules tree to be used

      • resetTreeClassName

        public static void resetTreeClassName()
        Set the default name of a class containing the rules tree to be used.

      • getRuleSetID

        public static long getRuleSetID(java.lang.String id)
        This method takes a product, assessment or sub rule set ID and converts it into a unique numerical ID for a rule set. The numerical id is calculated using the following algorithm: 
         
 Non numerical part of the input ID is dropped and then one of the
 following is done - 10000 is added to the remaining numerical part of
 product ID; 20000 is added to the remaining numerical part of assessment
 ID; 30000 is added to the remaining numerical part of sub rule set ID.
 40000 is added to the remaining numerical part of generic rule set ID.
        Parameters:
        id - full identifier of a product, assessment or sub rule set
        Returns:
        numerical ID for a rule set
